name: abstain
definition: to hold back oneself voluntarily

name: adulterate
definition: to debase or make impure by adding inferior materials

name: anomaly
definition: a deviation from the common rule

name: apathy
definition: absence of passion, emotion, or excitement; lack of interest

name: assuage
definition: to make milder or less severe; to appease/soothe

name: capricious
definition: subject to, led by, or indicative of a sudden, odd notion or unpredictable change; erratic

name: corroborate
definition: to make certain; to confirm

name: desiccate
definition: to dry up

name: engender
definition: to produce or cause

name: enigma
definition: a puzzling or inexplicable occurrence or situation:

name: ephemeral
definition: lasting a very short time

name: equivocal
definition: allowing the possibility of several different meanings; of doubtful nature

name: erudite
definition: characterized by great knowledge; learned or scholarly

name: fervid
definition: heated or vehement in spirit, enthusiasm, etc.

name: gullible
definition: easily deceived or cheated

name: homogeneous
definition: composed of parts or elements that are all of the same kind

name: laconic
definition: using few words; expressing much in few words; concise

name: laudable
definition: deserving praise; praiseworthy; commendable:

name: loquacious
definition: talking or tending to talk much or freely; talkative; chattering; babbling; garrulous; characterized by excessive talk; wordy:

name: lucid
definition: easily understood; completely intelligible or comprehensible:

name: mitigate
definition: to lessen in force

name: opaque
definition: not transparent or translucent; impenetrable to light

name: pedant
definition: one who is unimaginative or who unduly emphasizes minutiae in the presentation or use of knowledge; one who makes a show of knowledge

name: placate
definition: to appease or pacify, especially by concessions or conciliatory gestures

name: pragmatic
definition: of or relating to a practical point of view or practical considerations.

name: precipitate
definition: to hasten the occurrence of; bring about prematurely, hastily, or suddenly

name: proprietary
definition: pertaining to property or ownership

name: vacillate
definition: to waver in mind or opinion; be indecisive or irresolute

name: volatile
definition: changeable; mercurial; flighty

name: zeal
definition: fervor for a person, cause, or object; eager desire or endeavor; enthusiastic diligence; ardor
